_comment: Created by ianb on 03/10/2013 16:40:35 using v0.9
title: How have perceptions of inpatient rooms and ward cleanliness changed?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of patients responding that the hospital ward or room they were in was 'very clean' has increased markedly between 2005 and 2012, from 52% to 68%, whilst the proportion finding the hospital 'fairly clean' or 'very clean' has increased from 92% to 97%. Correspondingly the proportion of patients who found the room or ward 'not very clean' or 'not clean at all' dropped from 8% in 2005 to 3% in 2012.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
